column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Nine more Covid-19-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Thursday.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.Another 1
column2: 122 cases of coronavirus were reported in Northern Ireland on Thursday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column3: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.A total of 271
column4: 743 cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in Northern Ireland since the pandemic began.The figures show there are 349 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals in Northern Ireland on Thursday
column5: which was four more than Wednesday.Thirty-four Covid patients are in intensive care units.Last updated 28 October at 17:00 BSTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 2
column7: 224 vaccines for Covid-19 have been administered in Northern Ireland as of Thursday.A total of 1
column9: 684 people have received their second dose and 8
column10: 108 people have received their third dose.A total of 68
column11: 145 people have received their booster dose.Last updated 28 October at 17:00 BSTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandThe total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in the Republic of Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 5
column14: is updated weekly and includes "probable and possible" Covid-19-linked deaths.Another 2
column15: 605 cases of coronavirus were reported in the Republic of Ireland on Thursday.There were 487 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals and 99 patients with Covid-19 in hospital intensive care units on that day.Last updated 28 October at 17:20 local timeSource: Department of Health IrelandA total of 7
column17: 019 vaccines for Covid-19 had been administered in the Republic of Ireland as of Tuesday.A total of 3
column19: 890 people have received their second dose.Last updated 27 October at 14:30Source: Department of Health Ireland
